Again nothing so much awakens the judgement as that reverence, and modest timidity‚ which one feels upon those occasions, For do but reflect and tell me whether you would not be infinitely less affected if you were to speak before a single person only, though ever so learned, than before a numerous assembly‚ even though it were composed of none but illiterate people?
